paper.title: 2022年6月英语六级听力真题（第一套）

questions.question_text: What do we learn about the man?

options.text: He is a staff writer.
He is an adventurer.
He is an author of fiction.
He is a father of four kids.

questions.question_text: What does the man say about his children?

options.text: They are interested in fairy tales.
They are curious and autonomous.
They are a headache to their parents.
They are ignorant of politics.

questions.question_text: What does the man do to help his children with their writing?

options.text: He offers them ample editorial guidance.
He recommends model essays to them.
He gives them encouragement.
He teaches them proofreading.

questions.question_text: What happened to the man's daughter after she read a book about a refugee?

options.text: Her tastes in books changed.
She realized the power of reading.
Her reading opened her eyes to the world.
She began to perceive the world differently.

questions.question_text: What do we learn about the woman?

options.text: She is a website designer.
She is a university graduate.
She is a main street store owner.
She is a successful entrepreneur.

questions.question_text: What does the woman say about her early attempts at making clothes?

options.text: They were repeatedly rejected by shops.
They were popular with her classmates.
They showed her natural talent.
They were mostly failures.

questions.question_text: Why did the woman start making her own clothes?

options.text: She had a strong interest in doing it.
She did not like ready-made clothes.
She could not find clothes of her size.
She found clothes in shops unaffordable.

questions.question_text: What does the woman plan to do next?

options.text: Study fashion design at college.
Improve her marketing strategy.
Add designs for women.
Expand her business.

questions.question_text: What have researchers at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology done recently?

options.text: Utilizing artificial intelligence to find a powerful new antibiotic.
Discovering bacteria which are resistant to all known antibiotics.
Identifying bacterial strains that are most harmful to human health.
Removing a deadly strain of bacteria in humans with a new antibiotic.

questions.question_text: What is the challenge facing scientists in developing new antibiotics?

options.text: Ever increasing strains of bacteria.
Bacteria's resistance to antibiotics.
The similarity between known drugs.
The growing threat of bacteria to health.

questions.question_text: What can the new computer model do?

options.text: Dispense with experimental testing.
Predict whether compounds are toxic.
Foresee human reaction to antibiotics.
Combat bacteria's resistance to antibiotics.

questions.question_text: How do people normally detect lies according to the passage?

options.text: By theorization.
By generalization.
By observation.
By conversation.

questions.question_text: What does the passage say about people's beliefs concerning liars' behavior?

options.text: They are easy to detect.
They are well intended.
They are groundless.
They are harmless.

questions.question_text: What does the passage say about people's detection of lies?

options.text: Mostly by chance.
Basically objective.
Subject to their mental alertness.
Dependent on their analytical ability.

questions.question_text: What are people advised to do to detect lies effectively?

options.text: Looking the speaker in the eye.
Listening carefully to the speaker.
Measuring the speaker's breathing rate.
Focusing on the speaker's facial expressions.

questions.question_text: What does the speaker say about social workers?

options.text: They don't treat patients with due respect.
They witness a lot of doctor-patient conflicts.
They have to deal with social workers' strikes.
They don't care how much patients have to pay.

questions.question_text: What are patients advised to do in order to receive better treatment?

options.text: Appear submissive and grateful to doctors and nurses.
Express a strong desire to be consulted or informed.
Refrain from saying anything that sounds negative.
Note down the names of all the doctors and nurses.

questions.question_text: What kind of patients are medical staff more willing to help?

options.text: Cooperative.
Appreciative.
Passive.
Responsive.

questions.question_text: What does the speaker say about a successful team?

options.text: Its members work together despite risks of failure.
It prioritizes recruiting young energetic members.
Its members stay in touch even after it breaks up.
It grows more and more mature professionally.

questions.question_text: What have researchers found about team members?

options.text: Their differences are likely to impact productivity.
Their similarity is conducive to future collaboration.
Their connections strengthen with the passage of time.
Their mutual understanding stems from a common goal.

questions.question_text: What does the speaker say about the team he studied?

options.text: It is characterized by diversity.
Its goals are quite inconsistent.
Its members have similar backgrounds.
It is connected by a unique mechanism.

questions.question_text: What does the speaker say is the secret to wealth?

options.text: Putting aside twenty percent of one's earnings.
Spending in anticipation of becoming wealthy.
Living off a small proportion of one's income.
Saving as much as one can possibly manage.

questions.question_text: What is the advantage of having a financial plan according to the speaker?

options.text: It empowers them to cope with irrational emotions.
It will guarantee the profits from their investments.
It will turn them into successful financial planners.
It enables them to focus on long term investments.

questions.question_text: What do wealthy people do when their investments don't work out?

options.text: They count on others to take the responsibility.
They change their investment strategy in time.
They think they themselves are to blame.
They persist rather than get discouraged.

questions.question_text: What does the speaker say wealthy people don't do?

options.text: They do not resist novel lifestyles.
They do not try to keep up with others.
They do not care what they have acquired.
They do not pressure themselves to get rich.
